They will have to pause in some way and that will give Ukrainians opportunities to strike back," Richard Moore added.

175.title: Hypocrisy Zindabad: Jairam accuses Modi of destroying Khadi makers
175.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi tweeted on the anniversary of the tri-colour being adopted as India's National Flag, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticised him by commenting, "Hypocrisy Zindabad". "From someone [Modi] who is destroying livelihoods of those who make [Khadi] national flags...From someone who was a pracharak in the organisation that took 52 years to hoist the National Flag," Ramesh tweeted.

176.title: CBSE declares Class 10 results
176.article_body: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) on Friday announced the Class 10 results. Students can access their results on https://cbseresults.nic.in. This year, over 21 lakh students appeared for CBSE Class 10 exams. Earlier today, CBSE declared Class 12 results, with 92.71% students passing the exams.

177.title: Bihar CM urges Railways Minister to rename station after local temple
177.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has written a letter to Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw urging him to rename Raghunathpur Railway Station in Buxar after Baba Brahmeshwar Nath temple, which is located in the same district. This comes as Kumar laid the foundation stone for the temple's beautification project on Thursday. Locals have been demanding the same for "several" years, Kumar said.

178.title: Pune civic body election office makes changes to 3.45 lakh voters
178.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) election office made changes to 3.45 lakh voters and published the final ward-wise voters' list on Thursday. "After receiving 4,273 objections...election office carried out site visits," an official said. "The maximum number of objections had to do with voters residing in one ward while their names had been added to adjacent wards," the official added.

179.title: School was running hostel without license: Official on Kallakurichi death
179.article_body: The Kallakurichi school where a student had died by suicide on July 13 was running hostel without a license, Saraswathi Rangasamy, the chairperson of the Tamil Nadu State Commission for Protection of Child Rights (TNCPCR), said. "This school hasn't taken any measures to apply for [the license] and it is a punishable offence," she added.

180.title: RBI has zero tolerance for rupee volatility & bumpy movements: Guv
180.article_body: As the Indian rupee touched new lows against the US dollar in the last few months, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "We have zero tolerance for volatile and bumpy movement of the rupee." He added that while the rupee is better placed than other currencies against the US dollar, the RBI continues to remain watchful of headwinds.

181.title: Struggled for 7 yrs, everybody who came after me was overtaking me: Sudeepa
181.article_body: Sharing his experience during his struggling days, actor Kichcha Sudeepa said, "It took me almost...seven years to give my first good film." "I [later went] through a low for almost six-seven years...everybody who came after me [was] overtaking [me]," added Sudeepa. "I lived on ₹500 per month...I used to work in a clothes store," he had earlier stated.

182.title: If BJP has courage, let ED put cameras while questioning Sonia: Baghel
182.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that if the Bharatiya Janata Party has courage, they should let the Enforcement Directorate to put cameras at the place where Congress leader Sonia Gandhi is being questioned in the National Herald case. "Do you have that kind of courage? The country wants to know where scam has taken place," Baghel added.

183.title: Work on Pune's Sus-Pashan bridge to be completed by end of August
183.article_body: The work on Pune's Sus-Pashan bridge has reached the final stage and will be completed by end of August, officials said. A PMC executive engineer said that the work on the last slab started on Thursday. "Due to...heavy rains, we can't continue tar laying work right now. Other works are going on with great speed," the PMC executive engineer added.

184.title: Man tries to stab US Congressman Zeldin during stump speech; held
184.article_body: US Congressman Lee Zeldin was attacked by a knife-wielding man on Thursday. Zeldin, the Republican candidate for New York Governor, was delivering a stump speech when a man climbed on stage "and attempted to stab" him. Zeldin said he grabbed the attacker's wrist and stopped him for a few moments before others tackled the man. The accused has been detained.

185.title: Heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning issued for several states; list released
185.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning for several states over next few days. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura during July 22-24. Very heavy rainfall is expected over Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry, while extremely heavy rainfall is likely over parts of Gujarat.

186.title: Lower Oshiwara does not exist, change name of metro station: Residents
186.article_body: The residents of Lokhandwala have written to the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority demanding that the name Lower Oshiwara be changed. "There's no such place as Lower Oshiwara...moreover it'll...cause confusion...since next metro station on the same line is to be named Oshiwara," they said. "Hence, we request you to kindly change [its] name...to Lokhandwala," the residents added.

187.title: I have seen it 50 times: Ranbir on Sanjay Dutt-starrer 'Khalnayak'
187.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he has seen the 1993 film 'Khalnayak' which starred actors Sanjay Dutt and Madhuri Dixit Nene 50 times. "I was deeply impacted by 'Khalnayak'. It was the coolest film...coolest hero we'd ever seen on screen," added Ranbir. Discussing his favourite pan-Indian star, Ranbir mentioned actor Prabhas, who is known for acting in the 'Baahubali' film franchise.

188.title: Apple Watch helped detect a rare tumour in my heart, saved my life: US woman
188.article_body: A US woman claimed that Apple Watch saved her life after it warned that her heart was beating in an irregular pattern. Kim Durkee said she initially thought the warnings were false but her doctors confirmed that she had myxoma, a rare, fast-growing tumour. Doctors said the tumour was choking off her heart's blood supply and could've caused a stroke.

189.title: Anupam to play Jayaprakash Narayan in Kangana's 'Emergency', 1st look out
189.article_body: Anupam Kher has been roped in to portray political leader Jayaprakash Narayan in 'Emergency', an upcoming film which will feature Kangana Ranaut as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. Anupam took to Instagram to share his look for the film and wrote, "Happy...to essay the role of the man who questioned fearlessly, a rebel in the truest sense of the word."

190.title: Mumbai lawyer gets 3-yr jail for molesting client's 16-yr-old daughter
190.article_body: A lawyer in Mumbai was sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment for molesting a client's 16-year-old daughter. He was helping the woman file an affidavit after she lost her crucial documents. He later offered the woman, who was living on rent, his neighbour's flat if she let him have physical relationship with her daughter and also touched her inappropriately.

191.title: SBSP chief OP Rajbhar, an SP ally, gets 'Y' security from UP govt
191.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has provided 'Y' category security to Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief Om Prakash Rajbhar. This comes after Rajbhar announced his support for NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in the presidential election. Last month, Rajbhar had questioned SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's absence from campaigning for the Lok Sabha bypolls to Azamgarh and Rampur seats.

192.title: 8 arrested for offering namaz in public in Haridwar
192.article_body: Eight people were arrested for offering namaz at a weekly market in Haridwar, Uttarakhand. However, the accused were later granted bail by the sub-divisional magistrate's (SDM) court, police said. The accused were identified as Nizam (22), Nasim (52), Sajjad Ahmad (50), Mursalin (38), Ashraf (45), Asgar (37), Mustafa (35) and Ikram (47), and were arrested in Haridwar's Shivalik Nagar colony.

193.title: Johar denies favouring Janhvi on 'Koffee...', says 'Everybody read it wrong'
193.article_body: Karan Johar has responded to accusations of being biased towards Janhvi Kapoor and sidelining Sara Ali Khan on 'Koffee With Karan 7'. "That's completely untrue," Johar said, adding, "I was...feeling bad because Janhvi lost both rounds. She lost...rapid fire round and...the game round. I was perhaps just trying to be nice. In that process, I think everybody read it wrong."

194.title: 10 paedophiles travelled to Poland after Ukraine invasion: UK
194.article_body: British paedophiles have been travelling to Poland claiming they're providing "humanitarian assistance" to refugees fleeing war in Ukraine, UK's National Crime Agency said. Ten known sex offenders have travelled to Poland in the six weeks following the war, it added. "All 10 were asked to leave following an interview with Polish immigration...and law enforcement," the agency further said.

195.title: We can be Vishwa Guru only when Population Control Bill is brought: BJP MP
195.article_body: BJP MP Ravi Kishan will introduce a private member's bill on population control in Parliament on Friday. "We can be Vishwa Guru only when the Population Control Bill is brought. [It is] very important to bring the population under control. With the way in which it's rising, we're heading towards an explosion," said the Gorakhpur MP.

196.title: Sonia Gandhi didn't tell ED to end questioning: Jairam Ramesh
196.article_body: "The allegations that ED stopped investigation as Sonia Gandhi requested to leave because she is suffering from COVID-19 are baseless," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh clarified after reports stating that Sonia asked ED officials to stop questioning her in the National Herald case surfaced. "The interrogation ended because ED didn't have anything to ask," he added.

197.title: Minister says ₹15 for corn is high in MP, adds 'it's free here'; shares video
197.article_body: Union Minister of State in the Ministry of Steel and Ministry of Rural Development, Faggan Singh Kulaste took to Twitter to share a video of his interaction with a corn seller in Madhya Pradesh. In the video, Kulaste can be seen telling the corn seller that ₹15 per corncob is "too high" and that "it is sold for free here".

198.title: Educational institutions closed in UP's Moradabad on July 25, 26 amid Kanwar Yatra
198.article_body: All educational institutions in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad will be closed on July 25 and July 26 keeping in view the annual Kanwar Yatra, the district administration said. Many pilgrims will be offering prayers at temples and to prevent traffic jams and rush during these days, all the educational institutions will remain closed on Monday and Tuesday, the official order reads.

199.title: BYJU's owes ₹86.21 crore to BCCI; Paytm wants to exit as title sponsor: Report
199.article_body: Indian cricket team’s jersey sponsor BYJU's allegedly owes ₹86.21 crore as dues to the BCCI, as per a report. It further said that Paytm has requested BCCI to assign their India Home Cricket title rights to Mastercard. While BCCI's agreement with BYJU's was extended till the 2023 ODI World Cup, its agreement with Paytm is valid till March 31, 2023.

200.title: Man swallows heroin capsules worth ₹8.86 crore, held at TN airport
200.article_body: Customs officials have seized heroin worth ₹8.86 crore at the airport in Tamil Nadu's Chennai and arrested a man, who is a Tanzanian national, in connection to this. The accused had swallowed 86 capsules containing 1.26 kg of the drug, which were extracted from him. According to a release, the accused arrived in Chennai from Uganda's Entebbe on July 14.

201.title: LG VK Saxena calls for CBI probe into Delhi government's excise policy
201.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena called for a CBI probe into the alleged violation of the Delhi Excise Policy. This comes after Delhi Chief Secretary filed a report showing prima facie violations of various policies. There were "deliberate and gross procedural lapses" made by Manish Sisodia. Delhi government allegedly extended "undue favours" to liquor licensees after tenders had been awarded.

202.title: You'll never see my house, I don't allow guests to click pics: Ranveer
202.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he doesn't allow guests to take pictures of his house. "You'll never see my house," added Ranveer. Talking about life, Ranveer stated, "Life is an agonising...journey. If I'm angry, I get really...angry...I get overwhelmed...[daily]." Having recently posed nude, Ranveer said, "In some...performances I've been...f**king naked...I can be naked in front of...thousand people."

203.title: BJP wants to tarnish the image of Gandhi family: Adhir Chowdhury
203.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate questioned Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Thursday, party leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury alleged that BJP wants to tarnish the Gandhi family's image. "Will anybody...believe that the party that was in power for 54 years will commit a scam of ₹90 crore that too by...Sonia and Rahul Gandhi whose family members sacrificed their lives," Chowdhury asked.

204.title: 7-Eleven fires around 800 employees in US citing business restructuring
204.article_body: Convenience store chain 7-Eleven has fired about 800 people in the US citing business restructuring. The chain is owned by the Japanese retail conglomerate Seven & i Holdings. Last year in May, the 7-Eleven store chain completed the $21 billion acquisition of its rival Speedway convenience store chain from Marathon Petroleum.

205.title: Cristiano Ronaldo's agent Mendes offered him to Barca: Report
205.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's agent Jorge Mendes reportedly offered him to Barcelona before they signed Bayern Munich's Robert Lewandowski. Ronaldo was willing to accept a significant pay cut, the report added. Ronaldo is Real Madrid's all-time record goalscorer, having scored 451 goals in 438 matches, winning two LaLiga titles and four Champions League trophies. He currently represents Manchester United.

206.title: Airbnb Co-founder Joe Gebbia steps back from leadership role after 14 years
206.article_body: Airbnb's Co-founder Joe Gebbia has announced that he will step back from his full-time operating role at the company. "The primary reason for this transition is that...my brain is bursting with more ideas to bring to the world," Gebbia said. Gebbia founded Airbnb with his roommate Brian Chesky as they were looking to raise money to afford their apartment's rent.

207.title: My life changed after my father said 'I can't pay your loans': Samantha
207.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu said she didn't have a choice but to act due to her family struggling financially. "My father said..., 'I can't pay your loans,' that changed my life," added Samantha. Discussing the worst thing read about herself, Samantha mentioned reading about her getting ₹250 crore in alimony following her divorce with actor Nagarjuna Akkineni's son Naga Chaitanya.

208.title: I'm doing great: US Prez Biden after testing positive for COVID-19
208.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that he's "doing great" after testing positive for COVID-19. The 79-year-old, who's fully vaccinated and has twice received booster jabs, posted a video on Twitter, saying that he was "getting a lot of work done" and would continue with his duties. Biden will work in isolation until he tests negative, the White House said.

209.title: Truck hits girl as driver suffers heart attack in Punjab; driver dies
209.article_body: A truck hit a 14-year-old girl who was walking on the road in Punjab's Dhakoli on Thursday after the driver suffered a heart attack and lost control over the vehicle. The truck driver, who was declared dead at a hospital, was thrashed by onlookers who weren't aware of his medical emergency, police said. The girl was injured in the incident.

210.title: Video shows students kissing during 'truth and dare' game in K'taka; 1 student detained
210.article_body: A video of a boy and a girl, both students of a reputed Karnataka college kissing during a 'truth and dare' game has surfaced on social media. The boy who made the video has reportedly been detained for questioning. City police commissioner N Shashi Kumar said the incident had taken place six months ago at a private flat.

211.title: Will sit with photographers, they'll understand: Ranbir on attention after baby
211.article_body: While talking about media attention after his baby arrives, actor Ranbir Kapoor said that he will sit and have a conversation with the photographers. "I will sit down with them. They are lovely people, if you sit down with them and say something which means something to you, I think they will understand," he added.

212.title: Call me that, I don't care: Akshay on 'Canadian Kumar' tag
212.article_body: During the latest episode of 'Koffee With Karan Season 7', host Karan Johar asked Akshay Kumar if he gets trolled, to which the actor replied he doesn't go online much. "At...most, they write about Canada. Which I don't care," he added. When Karan pointed out that trolls call him 'Canada Kumar', Akshay said, "Yeah Canada Kumar. Okay, call me that."

213.title: Vedaant is getting a lot more attention than he actually deserves: Madhavan
213.article_body: R Madhavan has said his 16-year-old son, swimmer Vedaant, is getting a lot more attention than he actually deserves. Vedaant recently broke the national junior record in 1,500m freestyle swimming and won a gold medal at the Danish Open in April. "There are...better students than him in his age group in India...They need to be celebrated as well," Madhavan added.

214.title: African swine fever reported from 2 farms in Kerala's Wayanad
214.article_body: African swine fever has been reported among pigs from two farms at Mananthavady in Kerala's Wayanad, officials said. This comes after samples were tested at the National Institute of High Security Animal Diseases in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. "Now the test result has confirmed the infection. Directions have been issued to cull 300 pigs of the second farm," an official said.

215.title: 11 people arrested for selling foreign cigarettes illegally in Noida
215.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police and the district tobacco control committee together arrested 11 people for selling packets of cigarettes of foreign brands in Noida. Six shops in Sector 18 and five shops in Sector 57-61 area were found possessing foreign-brand cigarettes which did not comply with the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA), police said.

216.title: At least 18 people killed in police raid in Rio de Janeiro
216.article_body: At least 18 people were killed during a raid in a dense warren of Rio de Janeiro slums on Thursday. Sixteen of the dead were alleged criminals, while a police officer and a bystander were the other victims, police said. The raid allegedly targeted a criminal group involved in cargo theft, bank robberies and was planning operations in rival slums.

217.title: Mumbai man sends obscene messages, videos to over 600 women; arrested
217.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly hacking several WhatsApp accounts and sending obscene messages and videos to over 600 women. He intended to chat with the women and lure them to meet him, police said. The accused, who works as a data entry operator in a private bank, had been hacking WhatsApp accounts since 2019, police added.

218.title: UP launches scheme for cashless medical benefits for state employees, pensioners
218.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath launched a scheme to provide cashless medical facilities for state employees and pensioners at government-run institutions and medical colleges without any financial limit. The scheme will benefit around 22 lakh state government employees, pensioners and their dependents. A health card would be provided to the eligible employees and pensioners, Adityanath said.

219.title: Cyberabad police share video, ask people to drive slow on wet roads
219.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Friday shared a video of an accident and urged people to drive slow as "sudden braking can cause skidding of the vehicle on wet roads". Three people died in the accident which took place in Shamshabad, traffic police said. The video of the accident shows the vehicle skidding on the road and hitting another parked vehicle.

220.title: Akasa Air opens booking for flights in 4 cities; to operate 1st flight on Aug 7
220.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air has opened bookings for flights between Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Mumbai, and Kochi from July 22. The airline said it has opened ticket sales for 28 weekly flights that it will be operating on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad route from August 7, as well as for 28 weekly flights it will be operating on the Bengaluru-Kochi route from August 13.

221.title: 2 13-yr-old kids with illness become B'luru DCPs for a few hrs, pics surface
221.article_body: Two 13-year-old children who are battling "difficult" illnesses became Deputy Commissioners of Police for few hours in Bengaluru. IPS officer CK Baba, the Deputy Commissioner of Police, shared pictures of children in police uniforms. "A humbling day as I stood in attention to DCPs for day...we played small part in making their wish come true...for few hours only," he wrote.

222.title: Dinesh Gunawardena appointed as new Prime Minister of Sri Lanka
222.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Friday appointed senior politician Dinesh Gunawardena as the new Prime Minister of the country. Wickremesinghe is also expected to appoint his new cabinet today, a day after he was sworn into Sri Lanka's highest office. Earlier, security forces raided the main anti-government protest camp in the capital.

223.title: Fake doctor who prescribed medicines to patients booked in Pune
223.article_body: A case was filed against a fake doctor on Thursday for allegedly prescribing allopathic medicines to patients for his own financial benefits without proper knowledge in Pune's Narayangaon. The accused had reportedly put the initials 'Dr' in front of his name on the clinic's board. Police officials said that the accused had failed to submit necessary documents after being asked.

224.title: Jharkhand woman police constable, mother and daughter found dead at home
224.article_body: The bodies of a woman police constable, her mother and her daughter were found at the quarters made for the staff in policeline in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur, police said. "She had not been seen for the past two days. The door was locked from outside," Jamshedpur SSP Prabhat Kumar said. The locals reportedly became suspicious when a foul smell started emanating.

225.title: Japan to hold assassinated ex-PM Abe's state funeral on Sept 27
225.article_body: Japan will hold a state funeral for assassinated former PM Shinzo Abe on September 27 at Tokyo's Nippon Budokan, the government announced. The funeral will be fully paid for by state funds, Chief Cabinet Secretary Hirokazu Matsuno said. Activists and opposition parties have opposed the plan, saying the state shouldn't spend public money on an event for a political leader.

226.title: Which regions have the highest and lowest CBSE Class 12 pass percentage?
226.article_body: CBSE on Friday declared results of Class 12 board exams. Among regions, Trivandrum has the highest pass percentage of 98.83% followed by Bengaluru which has a pass percentage of 98.16%. Chennai, Delhi East and Delhi West are among the top 5 regions. Prayagraj has the lowest pass percentage of 83.71%. The overall pass percentage stood at 92.71% this year.

227.title: Studying History makes you cultured, Maths makes you retarded: Janhvi
227.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said she only cared about History and Literature while studying in school, adding those subjects can make someone a "cultured human". "Maths...makes you...retarded," added Janhvi. "I don't understand the point of [learning Maths]. Itna kyu maine sar toda?...I have not used algebra till now...What's the point?" she stated. Janhvi was recently seen in 'Koffee with Karan 7'.

228.title: Oppn unity is bit of chimera: Omar on TMC abstaining from VP poll voting
228.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Thursday reacted to TMC's decision to abstain from voting in Vice President elections, saying, "Opposition unity is a bit of a chimera." He added that "ultimately" political parties do what's in their own interest. Furthermore, he said that it's time for National Conference to do what suits it "rather than waste time chasing ghosts".

229.title: Man stabs himself, fakes robbery story to get family’s money in Gurugram
229.article_body: A 29-year-old man allegedly stabbed himself at his residence in Gurugram and faked a robbery story to siphon off his family's money. The man had claimed that four unidentified men posing as Wi-Fi technicians entered his house when he was alone and took away cash and valuables kept at home. Based on CCTV footage, police found that he was lying.

230.title: Ford rolls out last car from Chennai plant as it ends production in India
230.article_body: Ford India rolled out its last car, EcoSport, from its Chennai manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu ahead of its formal closure of the unit. Last year, Ford announced that it will end its manufacturing operations in India due to losses. Several visuals of the last unit decorated with flowers and balloons, along with the staff were shared on social media.

231.title: India reports 21,880 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,49,482
231.article_body: India has reported 21,880 COVID-19 cases and 60 related deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 21,566 COVID-19 cases. The number of active coronavirus cases in India stands at 1,49,482, according to the latest data. The total death toll so far has reached 5,25,930.

232.title: Case against Mukhtar Ansari after diary in 31-yr-old case goes missing
232.article_body: A case was registered against Uttar Pradesh politician Mukhtar Ansari on Wednesday in connection with the disappearance of the original diary of the 31-year-old Awadhesh Rai murder case, police said. FIR was registered for hatching a conspiracy to get the original case diary to disappear. The hearing of the case is being held in the MP-MLA court of Varanasi.

233.title: US reports its 1st polio case in nearly a decade
233.article_body: An adult in New York has become the first US resident in nearly a decade to contract polio, state health officials said. Officials further said that the person was unvaccinated, adding that how or where the infected resident was exposed remains under evaluation. The last known US case of polio virus was recorded in 2013.

234.title: He was good: Kartik reacts to Ranveer mimicking him on 'Koffee...'
234.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has reacted to Ranveer Singh imitating him on Karan Johar's 'Koffee With Karan 7'. He said that he hasn't seen the episode yet, but has watched the clip of Ranveer. "He is really watching my videos. He was good," Kartik said, adding, "But, I actually say 'thank you' and not just mime it."

235.title: FIFA 23 game briefly listed for ₹4.8 instead of ₹4,799 on Epic Games store
235.article_body: Epic Games briefly listed the FIFA 23 Ultimate Edition game for about ₹4.8 instead of its actual price of ₹4,799 on its store. The listing error took about 30 minutes to be fixed, allowing several users in India to place pre-orders for the game. As per reports, users from other regions were also able to buy the game for ₹4.8.

236.title: Your per day fee is my salary for entire film: Samantha on Akshay
236.article_body: During her appearance on 'Koffee with Karan 7' alongside actor Akshay Kumar, actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu said his per day fee while starring in a film is equal to her salary for an entire movie. Discussing things he won't do for money, Akshay stated, "There is a price for everything." Samantha featured in the song 'Oo Antava' from 'Pushpa'.

237.title: Anil debuted in South, Sridevi was South actress: Vijay on North-South debate
237.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said that the North and South industries have always worked together and that "now it's loud". "Anil Kapoor sir debuted down South. Directors have been making films up North. Sridevi ma'am has been a South actor...It's just that now we are doing cinema that the entire country watches and it's about time that this happens," he added.

238.title: Madhavan, son Vedaant meet Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, actor shares pics
238.article_body: R Madhavan, his wife Sarita Birje and their son Vedaant recently met Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik. The actor shared pictures on his Instagram handle, in which Patnaik could be seen giving an Odisha jersey to Vedaant. "Thank you...for the...hospitality and the most fantastic endeavour of putting Odisha firmly on one of the Best Sports Venue [maps]...of India," Madhavan wrote.

239.title: CBSE announces Class 12 results
239.article_body: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) on Friday announced the Class 12 results. Students can access their results on https://cbseresults.nic.in. Alternatively, candidates can check their results via the DigiLocker app. This year, over 14 lakh students appeared for CBSE Class 12 exams.

240.title: Bengaluru reports 1,285 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
240.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,285 new COVID-19 cases and 1,242 recoveries, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Thursday. The number of active cases was 7,107, while the infection positivity rate stood at 6.32%. No deaths were reported in this period. Nearly two crore vaccines have been administered so far in the city.

241.title: Man kills daughter, attacks family over tea in Northeast Delhi
241.article_body: A 45-year-old man allegedly attacked his family with glass shard following a dispute over tea in Northeast Delhi. While his 18-year-old daughter died of injuries, his wife and two other daughters were wounded. The accused had asked his daughters to buy milk for tea, but his wife told him to do it himself, which led to an argument, police said.

242.title: Bengaluru to get AI-powered traffic cameras at 50 intersections
242.article_body: Bengaluru will get artificial intelligence-powered Red Light Violation Detection (RLVD) cameras at 50 traffic intersections, according to authorities. These cameras will be able to detect eight violations, including not wearing seatbelt, overspeeding, triple riding, one-way riding, using a cell phone, crossing stop lines and riding without a helmet. The cameras will be installed in August.

243.title: Ex-US policeman gets 2.5 years in jail over George Floyd's murder
243.article_body: A former US policeman has been jailed for two-and-a-half years for violating African-American George Floyd's civil rights. Thomas Lane was found guilty of showing "deliberate indifference" to the medical needs of Floyd when former police officer Derek Chauvin pinned the handcuffed Floyd's neck to the ground with a knee for more than nine minutes in May 2020, causing his death.

244.title: Gauhati HC grants bail to 19-yr-old student held under UAPA for FB post
244.article_body: Gauhati High Court granted bail to the 19-year-old college student, Barshashree Buragohain, who was arrested under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) for allegedly writing an "anti-national poem" on Facebook. Buragohain's post allegedly supported militant group ULFA(I). Notably, the post made no mention of the outfit. The lines "were an implicit endorsement of ULFA(I)", FIR stated.

245.title: Video shows Donald Trump refusing to say 'the election is over' after losing
245.article_body: A video from January 7, 2021 shows the then US President Donald Trump refusing to say that "the election is over" after losing. The video was released by the committee probing the attack on US Capitol. "I just want to say Congress has certified the results without saying the election is over," Trump can be heard saying in the video.

246.title: 3 arrested for stealing 280m of cables from Rapid Metro Line in Gurugram
246.article_body: Three men were arrested for allegedly stealing 280 metres of copper cables worth ₹9 lakh from the Rapid Metro Line in Gurugram. The suspects revealed they had sold the stolen copper cables for ₹2 lakh to a scrap dealer and had conducted two similar thefts in Delhi as well, police said. Notably, two of the suspects were arrested from Ghaziabad.

247.title: Instagram videos less than 15 minutes to be now shared as Reels
247.article_body: Instagram has announced that videos that are shorter than 15 minutes will now be shared as Reels. However, it added that videos posted prior to this change won’t become Reels. The company also said that videos and Reels will now be consolidated under one tab on a user’s profile to create a single home for all their videos.

248.title: Needed money to buy my house, got it after more 'Jaani..' screen time: Akshay
248.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said he needed money to buy house he currently lives in and that became possible after his on-screen timing was increased in 'Jaani Dushman' after another actor could not come for shoot as he was stuck. "I was on per-day basis...villain kills me [in movie]...I [went to] director [and said] 'Should I come back?'" Akshay added.

249.title: 2 Indian brothers, their friend charged in first crypto insider trading case in US
249.article_body: Two Indian brothers and their Indian-American friend have been charged in the first-ever insider trading scheme involving cryptocurrencies in US. Former Coinbase manager Ishan Wahi, his brother Nikhil Wahi and Sameer Ramani used confidential information about which crypto assets were set to be listed on the platform's exchanges. They made illegal trades, realising $1.5 million in illicit profits.

250.title: Eldhose creates history, becomes 1st Indian to reach triple jump final at World C'ships
250.article_body: Eldhose Paul has created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to reach triple jump final in the history of World Athletics Championships. The 25-year-old advanced to the final with a best jump of 16.68 metres. He finished 12th in the qualification round. The final will take place on Sunday (IST).

251.title: US-based firm Meta.is to sue Meta for stealing its name
251.article_body: A US-based virtual reality company META.is is suing Meta for allegedly stealing its name and violating the company’s established brand. Meta.is in a post wrote, "Facebook seized our META mark and name, which we put our blood, sweat and tears into building for over 12 years." It added that it had discussed a potential partnership with Facebook in 2017.

252.title: 2nd autopsy conducted in my absence: Kallakurichi student's father to SC
252.article_body: The father of the 17-year-old Class 12 girl student, who allegedly died by suicide in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi, claimed that her second autopsy was conducted in his absence. He had moved the SC seeking a particular team of doctors in the panel constituted to do the second post-mortem. The father withdrew his petition seeking a stay on the second autopsy.

253.title: Delhi govt to begin coaching classes for underprivileged class 10, 12 students
253.article_body: Delhi government will begin special classes for class 10 and 12 students from marginalised backgrounds starting next week under the Jai Bhim Mukhyamantri Pratibha Vikas Yojna. Under this programme, the government provides free coaching to talented students of scheduled castes, scheduled tribes and poor families for competitive exams like JEE, medical and civil services.

254.title: Pune police arrest 2 people for cheating 4 BJP MLAs of ₹3,400 each
254.article_body: A Pune police official said on Thursday that two people were arrested for allegedly cheating four BJP MLAs of ₹3,400 each after one of the duo sought the money claiming that his mother was hospitalised. The accused had reportedly required the money for daily needs. The duo was nabbed using a telephonic tracing system, DCP (Zone 5) Namrata Patil said.

255.title: 2nd youngest kid in India with rare disorder gets bariatric surgery in Mumbai
255.article_body: A 20-month old child, Ibrahim Khan, has become the second youngest child in India to undergo bariatric surgery in India. According to reports, he has Leptin receptor (LepR) deficiency. His surgery was performed in Mumbai. His elder sister Zoya, now 12 years old, also has same genetic disorder and was the youngest in the country to undergo bariatric surgery.

256.title: Sri Lankan troops raid main anti-govt protest camp as new Prez takes over
256.article_body: Sri Lankan security forces have raided the main anti-government protest camp in the capital Colombo and cleared out a section of it. The troops armed with batons and assault rifles swooped in on protesters camping at the Presidential Secretariat, saying the protesters have "no legal right to hold it". This comes after Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as President.

257.title: Man jailed for sexually assaulting 5-yr-old girl: Rachakonda Police
257.article_body: Rachakonda Police said on Friday that a sessions court has sentenced a 67-year-old man to three years in jail on charges of sexually assaulting a five-year-old girl in 2015. The police added that Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat and Additional Police Commissioner G Sudheer Babu announced a reward for the IO, CDO and Additional Public Prosecutor for their efforts.

258.title: 2 Indians to feature in men's javelin throw final at World C'ships for 1st time
258.article_body: Neeraj Chopra and Rohit Yadav have qualified for the men's javelin throw final at the World Athletics Championships 2022. With this, two Indians will feature in the men's javelin throw final at World Athletics Championships for the first time in history. Chopra qualified with a best throw of 88.39 metres, while Yadav qualified with a best throw of 80.42 metres.

259.title: $80 billion wiped off combined m-cap of companies that sell online ads in a day
259.article_body: About $80 billion was wiped out of the combined market value of companies that sell online ads after Snap reported poor quarterly results. While shares of Alphabet fell 3%, wiping out over $40 billion from its market capitalisation, Meta Platforms dropped 5%, erasing about $25 billion in market value. Snap shares fell 25%, cutting its market value by $7 billion.

260.title: Who cares, do I look 55: Akshay Kumar on working with younger actresses
260.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that those who criticise him for working with younger actresses are "jealous". "I can work with them. Do I look 55? I don't understand the problem. They just get jealous and keep on writing it. Some media person will write and some trolling will happen. Who cares?" he added.

261.title: 35-year-old drunk man kills 60-year-old father in Pune, arrested
261.article_body: A 35-year-old man has been arrested for killing his 60-year-old father in Pune, police said. The accused, who was in an inebriated state, had a heated argument with his father when the murder took place on July 15, police added. The incident came to light after the deceased's brother suspected his nephew as he was missing after the incident.

262.title: If you put us both in a room, you have to hide sharp objects: Samantha on ex-husband
262.article_body: While talking about her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya on Koffee with Karan Season 7, Samantha Ruth Prabhu said, "Like if you put us both in a room, you have to hide sharp objects." Samantha said this when Karan Johar asked if there were any hard feelings between her and Naga. She added that the situation was not amicable right now.

263.title: It's a good motivation to work out: Musk on jokes over his Mykonos shirtless pics
263.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user over jokes about his recent shirtless pictures in Mykonos, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "It's good motivation to work out, eat healthier and maybe take my shirt off outside more than once a year." The user had tweeted, "Anyone posting a shirtless pic of Musk...must...post a shirtless picture of themselves for comparison".

264.title: IAS officer shares his Class 10 marksheet, jokes 'It remained classified since 1997'
264.article_body: IAS officer Shahid Choudhary shared a picture of his Class 10 marksheet, revealing he got 339/500 marks. He wrote, "On students' demand...here's my...marksheet which remained 'classified' since 1997." Responding to a comment on his low marks in Mathematics and Social Studies, he wrote, "Friends proved helpful in Mathematics...while I...avenged Social Studies' [marks] by taking Sociology in UPSC."

265.title: 27-yr-old woman killed as her car crashes into metro pillar in Gurugram
265.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was killed after her car allegedly crashed into a metro pillar on Golf Course Road in Gurugram on Wednesday, police said. When her daughter was returning home after meeting her friends, an unknown vehicle being driven rashly hit her daughter's car from the side, the woman's mother claimed. "Her car got imbalanced...rammed into the pillar," she added.

266.title: Who were the top remittance recipients among low and middle income nations in 2021?
266.article_body: As per a WHO report, India was the top remittance recipient in 2021 among low and middle income countries. India received $87 billion in remittance in 2021, the report said. India is followed by China and Mexico ($53 billion each). Meanwhile, Philippines and Egypt received $36 billion and $33 billion in remittance, respectively.

267.title: 3 arrested in Delhi for trafficking tribal women in guise of placement agency
267.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday rescued 10 tribal women, including six minors, from the premises of an illegal placement agency in Mukundpur. Of the four identified as accused in the case, three have been arrested and the prime accused is still absconding. Prime accused had organised the entire syndicate of getting girls from Jharkhand over a period of time, police said.

268.title: Navi Mumbai man injured after ceiling plaster falls on him while sleeping
268.article_body: A 52-year-old man escaped with injuries after plaster from the ceiling of a City and Industrial Development Corporation (CIDCO)-constructed building fell on him in Navi Mumbai. The false ceiling neutralised the plaster's impact to some extent, the man said. Residents said this was the fourth incident of plaster falling since the man has been living in the house since 2003.

269.title: 4 held for alleged robbery, extortion in B'luru; ₹6 lakh recovered
269.article_body: Bengaluru Police have caught four people accused of involvement in extortion and robbery cases at multiple locations in the city. The police also recovered five two-wheeler vehicles and 20 mobile phones, the total of which is said to be around ₹6 lakh. All mobile phones were used for extortion and other illegal activities by the gang, reports said.

270.title: Neeraj Chopra qualifies for World C'ships final with 3rd best throw of his career
270.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has qualified for the men's javelin throw final at the World Athletics Championships 2022 with the third-best throw of his career. The 24-year-old advanced to the final by producing a best throw of 88.39 metres in his first attempt in the qualification round. The final will take place on Sunday (IST).

271.title: Pujara slams 3rd double ton in county this season; Sundar, Saini take five-wicket hauls
271.article_body: Chesteshwar Pujara slammed his third double hundred for Sussex in the ongoing county season. While, Washington Sundar and Navdeep Saini took five-wicket hauls for their county debut for Lancashire and Kent, respectively. Pujara slammed the double ton against Middlesex at Lord's while Sundar and Saini took their five-wicket hauls against Northamptonshire and Warwickshire, respectively.

272.title: 25-km Kanwar yatra to spread gender equality message in U'khand on July 26
272.article_body: A 25-km Kanwar yatra to spread the message of gender equality will be held in Uttarakhand on July 26. The yatra will start at Har Ki Pairi and end with a 'jalabhishek' at Veerbhadra temple in Rishikesh. State Women Empowerment Minister Rekha Arya, yoga guru Baba Ramdev and Panchdashnam Joona Akhada chief patron Harigiri Maharaj will be present there.

273.title: Real fascism: Cong as TV anchor booked for 'criticising' Kerala MP
273.article_body: Leader of Opposition in the Kerala Assembly, VD Satheesan, criticised police for booking Asianet TV news anchor Vinu V John for a comment he allegedly made during a TV discussion in March. John had made some observations regarding Elamaram Kareem, a Rajya Sabha MP from Kerala. Satheesan said booking an anchor for "raising criticism" against an MP is "real fascism".

274.title: 23-yr-old dies by suicide over fall in viewership on YouTube channel
274.article_body: A 23-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Hyderabad on Thursday reportedly due to fall in number of viewers on his YouTube channel, officials said. The deceased was a student of IIITM, Gwalior and was currently attending classes online. Police said he jumped from the third floor of his residential building in the morning and died on the spot.

275.title: Spain, Portugal resist EU calls to cut gas consumption by 15%
275.article_body: Spain and Portugal on Thursday said they would not support the European Commission's proposal to reduce gas consumption by 15% amidst fears that Russia could cut off supplies ahead of winter. Madrid and Lisbon said they use very little Russian gas in comparison to other EU nations and their energy supplies are very different from the rest of Europe.

276.title: UK's Supreme Court to hear Scotland's independence case in October
276.article_body: The UK Supreme Court on Thursday said it will hear arguments on whether Scotland can conduct an independence referendum without the British government's approval in October this year. Pro-independence Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon said Scotland's plebiscite on secession will be held on October 19, 2023. Outgoing Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s government has denied any such vote now.

277.title: Tantrik allegedly promises to land woman job using witchcraft, rapes her in Raj
277.article_body: A 27-year-old married woman has alleged that a 40-year-old tantrik has been raping her for the past one year in Rajasthan, police said. The woman also claimed that the accused, named Champalal, recorded some obscene videos and blackmailed her. The woman stated that she fell in Champalal's trap after he promised to land her a job using witchcraft, police said.

278.title: Passengers de-boarded after bomb scare on Patna-Delhi IndiGo flight, plane being checked
278.article_body: All 134 passengers were de-boarded at Patna airport after a bomb scare on a Patna-Delhi IndiGo flight on Thursday night. The plane is being checked by bomb disposal squad, said reports. According to reports, a passenger of the flight himself said that he is carrying a bomb in the bag.

279.title: Roof collapse kills four of a family in Punjab's Patiala
279.article_body: A roof collapse of a house killed four members of a family and injured one in Punjab's Patiala, the police said. The collapse of the roof occurred due to heavy rains while the members of the family were sleeping inside the rented accommodation at Jakhal Road in Patran. The injured, identified as 15-year-old Vikas, sustained head injuries, an official said.

280.title: Karnataka to serve eggs in midday meals to tackle malnutrition
280.article_body: The Karnataka government decided to include boiled eggs, bananas and groundnut cakes in midday meals for students from class 1-8 to tackle malnutrition. Education Minister BC Nagesh said that vegetarian students will not be forced to consume eggs. Calling these the best available protein-rich food items, he said that the eggs will be boiled in the school premises.

281.title: Jammu-Srinagar national highway reopens for one-way traffic
281.article_body: The 270 km Jammu-Srinagar national highway reopened for one-way traffic on Thursday, after it was shut down due to landslides owing to heavy rainfall in Ramban district, as per officials. Nearly 1,000 vehicles stranded at different points in the district were allowed to move. Work is underway to clear the highway for two-way traffic, Ramban police added.

282.title: State-wise list of votes polled in Presidential election released
282.article_body: BJP-led NDA's candidate Droupadi Murmu won the Presidential election by securing 64.03% votes. Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha received 35.97% votes. The state-wise list of votes polled in the election shows Yashwant didn't receive a single vote in Andhra Pradesh, Sikkim and Nagaland. President-elect Murmu received 181 votes in Maharashtra and 287 in Uttar Pradesh.

283.title: BJP govt misusing central agencies, democracy is in danger: Gehlot
283.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot slammed the central government for misusing central agencies, like the Enforcement Directorate, and said that democracy is in danger, ahead of Congress interim president Sonia Gandhi's appearance before the agency. "Our fight is to save the nation. Today, if they (BJP) would have been in our place, they would have indulged in arson," said Gehlot.

284.title: China is now top priority for British intelligence: MI6 chief
284.article_body: China is now the top priority for UK's Secret Intelligence Service, MI6 chief Richard Moore said on Thursday. Understanding how China pursues its strategic goals is a particularly complex challenge, he added. "And there's a role for organisations like mine in helping British...policymakers to understand that, so they can navigate this...difficult relationship with the Chinese," he further said.

285.title: Ranveer Singh poses nude for Paper magazine
285.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has posed nude in an article for 'Paper' magazine. Speaking to the magazine, he said, "In some of my performances I've been damn f**king naked...That's being actually naked." "I can be naked in front of a thousand people, I don't give a shit. It's just that they get uncomfortable," Ranveer added.

286.title: Choubey appointed C'garh Panchayat & Rural Development Minister
286.article_body: Chhattisgarh government named Ravindra Choubey as the state's Panchayat and Rural Development Minister on Thursday. The 65-year-old has replaced TS Singh Deo, who resigned from the post on July 16. While resigning, he said he was unable to fulfil the targets of the department. He also claimed that funds weren't sanctioned under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana despite his repeated requests.

287.title: Shining example of women empowerment: Patnaik on Droupadi Murmu
287.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik congratulated Droupadi Murmu on Thursday for her victory in the Presidential elections. "Her journey from a humble beginning to become the First Citizen of the country is...inspiring...Her journey is a shining example of women empowerment," the CM tweeted. "[I] congratulate the daughter of Odisha," he added. President-elect Murmu was born in a tribal family in Odisha.

288.title: Truth will prevail over 'arrogance & dictatorship': Rahul Gandhi
288.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at the Central government on Thursday over its unwillingness to discuss issues like inflation and misuse of agencies, asserting that "the truth will prevail over dictatorship". His attack came on the day Congress president Sonia Gandhi appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning in the National Herald money laundering case.

289.title: Heatwaves predicted to return to China over next 10 days
289.article_body: Heatwaves are forecast to return to China over the next 10 days with temperatures expected to rise across the country, meteorologists warned on Thursday. This comes days after 86 cities in the country, including Shanghai, issued red alerts amid soaring temperatures. Notably, heatwaves and wildfires are being reported across several parts of the world, including the United Kingdom and Spain.

290.title: Ship spills 35,000 gallons of fuel off island in Bahamas
290.article_body: A ship spilled around 35,000 gallons of fuel into the ocean off an island in The Bahamas on Wednesday. The crew of the ship had deployed absorbent pads and containment buoys, according to a statement from Bahamas-based Sun Oil. Notably, the island of Great Exuma is famed for its white sand beaches and crystal-blue waters.

291.title: Opium worth ₹10 crore seized in Guwahati
291.article_body: Police seized opium worth ₹10 crore and arrested four persons in connection with it in Assam's Guwahati on Thursday. Officials said the 20503 Dibrugarh-New Delhi Rajdhani Express train was raided based on a tip-off. "The weight of opium is 10.11 kg and market value is approximately ₹10 crore. They were carrying the opium from Dimapur to Howrah," an official said.

292.title: US publishes list of suspected corrupt actors in Central America
292.article_body: The US State Department has released a list of 60 current and former officials suspected of corruption in Central American nations Honduras, El Salvador, Guatemala and Nicaragua. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said these individuals contribute to irregular migration and destabilising societies. The US visas of those mentioned in the list are generally revoked.

293.title: Italy's Prez dissolves Parliament after PM Draghi's resignation
293.article_body: Italy's President Sergio Mattarella dissolved the country's Parliament on Thursday, clearing the way for an early election. "The dissolution of the parliamentary chamber is always the last choice," Mattarella said. Notably, the development comes after Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi's resignation earlier today following the collapse of his national unity government.

294.title: Turkey denies conducting airstrikes in northern Iraq
294.article_body: Turkey on Thursday dismissed reports that its military carried out airstrikes in northern Iraq on Wednesday, killing eight tourists. Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu said Ankara was ready to cooperate with Baghdad to ascertain who carried out the "treacherous attack" in the Kurdish-run district of Zakho. Cavusoglu said Turkey's fight in Iraq is with only the Kurdistan Workers Party.

295.title: President-elect Murmu greets Union ministers outside Delhi home
295.article_body: President-elect Droupadi Murmu on Thursday greeted Union ministers, political leaders and media present outside her residence in Delhi. Union ministers Dharmendra Pradhan and Kiren Rijiju were among those who met her. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi and BJP chief JP Nadda visited Murmu's residence to congratulate her on being elected as the 15th President of India.

296.title: 'Namaste Vietnam' festival to mark 75 yrs of Indian Independence
296.article_body: The first-ever 'Namaste Vietnam' fest will be held in Ho Chi Minh City and Nha Trang from August 12-21 to mark 75 years of India's independence. The 10-day festival has been planned in accordance with India's 'Act East policy' and will also mark 50 years of diplomatic ties between the countries, official release stated. Several celebrities will attend the festival.

297.title: Iran recalls envoy to Sweden in protest over ex-official's jail sentence
297.article_body: Iran has recalled its ambassador to Sweden in protest against a jail sentence handed by Swedish court to an ex-Iranian prison official. The court said that Hamid Noury, who was sentenced to life in jail, had participated in "executions of many political prisoners" in the 1980s. However, Iran said that the verdict "is based on baseless, distorted and fabricated accusations".

298.title: Golden moment for India: BJP chief congratulates President-elect Murmu
298.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Thursday congratulated Droupadi Murmu on being elected as the 15th President of the country. He said this is a golden moment for India. "Murmu's elevation to the highest office of the country today shows that the BJP government is determined for the welfare of every section," Nadda said.

299.title: NCLT orders insolvency proceedings against Future Retail
299.article_body: The Mumbai bench of National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) on Wednesday allowed a consortium of lenders, led by Bank of India (BoI), to initiate insolvency proceedings against debt-laden Future Retail. The tribunal also rejected e-commerce major Amazon's objection to BoI's petition. Amazon had alleged that the petition to initiate insolvency proceedings against the Indian retailer was "malicious".

300.title: Historic moment as Prez's post will be held by tribal woman: Meghalaya CM
300.article_body: After Droupadi Murmu was elected as the President of India, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said, "It's a great and historic moment as the President's post will now be held by a tribal woman." "It's something that was inconceivable many years ago. I'd like to thank all who voted for our President, PM and others...who made this possible," he said.

301.title: Al Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri is alive, lives in Afghanistan: UN
301.article_body: Al Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri is alive and resides in Afghanistan where he communicates openly, a recent report by the UN has claimed. The report further stated that ties between the Taliban and Al Qaeda are still strong. Separately, the report noted that the Islamic State (IS) is using Afghanistan as a platform for its global expansion.

302.title: 5 Kanwariyas saved from drowning while bathing in Ganga in U'khand
302.article_body: Five Kanwariyas were saved from drowning while bathing in the Ganga in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Thursday, an official said. The strong currents of the river swept them away, the official added. Jawans of the 40th battalion of the Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) deployed on the banks of the river saved the Kanwariyas, who were residents of Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad.

303.title: Shah congratulates Murmu, says 'she fought against odd circumstances'
303.article_body:
Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday congratulated Droupadi Murmu on being elected the President of India. He said, "[She] has reached this highest position of the country today after fighting against the odd circumstances...it shows the immense power of our democracy."
Murmu, belonging to Odisha's tribal community, was elected as India's 15th President.

304.title: How many recruitments were made by UPSC, SSC and IBPS in the last 2 years?
304.article_body: The government on Thursday stated in Rajya Sabha that during the last two years amid COVID-19 pandemic, the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC), Staff Selection Commission (SSC) and Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) recruited 1,59,615 people. As per the data shared by the government, the UPSC recruited 8,913 people, SSC recruited 97,914 people and IBPS recruited 52,788 people.

305.title: Arjun Kapoor sells Mumbai flat bought for ₹20 crore at ₹16 crore: Report
305.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor sold his apartment in 81 Aureate building in Bandra West for ₹16 crore, as per reports. The 4,364-square-foot flat is on the 19th floor of the building. Arjun reportedly purchased the property last year for ₹20 crore. Arjun's sister, Anshula, signed the sale papers and the stamp duty paid for the registration was ₹96 lakh, reports added.

306.title: K'taka to bring policy to ensure power supply to every household: CM
306.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said the state government has decided to bring a policy to ensure power supply to every poor household in the state. Addressing a crowd at the 53rd Formation Day of Karnataka Power Corporation, Bommai said, "Electricity is one of the essential services...It's the duty of the government to provide electricity just like supply of drinking water."

307.title: Indonesian pilot dies after landing passenger plane amid health issue
307.article_body: The pilot of a passenger airplane in Indonesia suffered a health emergency after take-off on Thursday and was forced to return to the airport before being rushed to a hospital where he later died. However, the cause of the pilot's death wasn't immediately known. Citilink Indonesia said that all crew were declared fit in health checks prior to the flight.

308.title: Many nations are trying to run cricket like football: PCB chief Ramiz Raja
308.article_body: PCB Chairman Ramiz Raja said many nations are trying to run cricket like football. "They'll realise what they've done when they complete the calendar. They will realise that if your captain isn't strong, your team can't progress," he added. Ramiz further said, "I haven't interfered in the team selections, even though I can do it. It is my right."

309.title: WestBridge Capital raises $1.5 bn to invest in Indian firms: Report
309.article_body: Investment fund WestBridge Capital has raised $1.5 billion to invest in Indian companies, as per reports. WestBridge Capital has backed unicorns such as LEAD and Vedantu, and this is its largest-ever fund for India-focused companies. WestBridge Capital's total portfolio includes as many as 132 companies, and its assets under management in India have reportedly crossed $10 billion.

310.title: SC halts hearing in Gyanvapi mosque case till Varanasi court verdict
310.article_body: Supreme Court has decided to halt the hearing of appeal filed by Gyanvapi mosque's management committee till Varanasi court announces its verdict on the committee's plea questioning the maintainability of the suit filed by Hindu plaintiffs. It adjourned the hearing to October. It also refused to entertain petitions seeking the right to worship the alleged 'Shivling' found at the site.

311.title: Hang killers of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal: LS member
311.article_body: Speaking in the Parliament, Lok Sabha member Arjun Lal Meena called for the hanging of the killers of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal. He said capital punishment would prove to be a deterrent for those who plan to destabilise peace in Udaipur. He also called for a ban on activities of Dawat-e-Islami, a Pakistan-based organisation allegedly linked to the incident.

312.title: Fast food chain Burger Singh raises ₹30 cr in Series A round
312.article_body: Homegrown fast food chain Burger Singh has raised ₹30 crore in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Negen Capital and saw participation from LetsVenture, Mumbai Angels, Old World Hospitality and singer Jasleen Royal, along with existing investors. The company aims to use the funds to launch 120 food court outlets in the current fiscal.

313.title: Ex-RJD MLA Anant Singh sentenced to 10 yrs in jail in another arms case
313.article_body: Former RJD MLA Anant Singh was on Thursday sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment in another case relating to recovery of arms and explosives from his residence. He was awarded the same quantum of sentence by the court in June in a 2019 case relating to the recovery of an AK-47 rifle, ammunition and grenades from his Mokama residence.

314.title: Unmarried woman cannot be denied choice to abort: Supreme Court
314.article_body: The Supreme Court passed an interim order allowing an unmarried woman to terminate her 24-week pregnancy, provided her life is not endangered. Justice DY Chandrachud noted that the 2021 amendment in Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act used the term 'partner' instead of husband. Parliamentary intent is not to confine the benefits to situations arising out of marriages, the bench observed.

315.title: UP ministers to hold road shows in over 20 countries ahead of investors' meet
315.article_body: Uttar Pradesh ministers will be going on foreign tours to showcase the state as an 'investment hub' ahead of the Global Investor Summit, 2023 in the state. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has set a target of ₹10 lakh crore in investments in the summit. The event will have one day dedicated to the Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises sector.

316.title: Gutkha worth ₹17.50 lakh seized from 2 Navi Mumbai houses, one held
316.article_body: Gutkha, pan masala and tobacco products worth ₹17.50 lakh were seized after raids were conducted at two houses in Navi Mumbai's Kopar Khairane and Ghansoli. Police said they arrested 37-year-old Manoj Kumar Narendra Khanda, who stocked the banned products. During the raid, 32 sacks of pan masala, 15 sacks of tobacco and 11 sacks of scented pan masala were found.

317.title: Edtech platform Creative Galileo raises $7.5 mn in Series A round
317.article_body: Early learning edtech platform Creative Galileo has raised $7.5 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Kalaari Capital, Affirma Capital, East Ventures, Valiant Employee Investment Fund, and angel investors. Founded in July 2020 by Prerna A Jhunjhunwala and Nikhil Naik, the startup claims to have over 7 million downloads. It has 7,00,000 monthly active users.

318.title: 151 grams of gold worth ₹7.82 lakh seized at Jaipur airport
318.article_body: The Customs officials seized 151 grams of gold worth ₹7.82 lakh from a passenger who arrived at Jaipur International Airport from Dubai, an official said on Thursday. "The smuggled gold of 99.50 purity...has been seized under the provisions of the Customs Act, 1962," the official said. A gold bangle and a ring were found concealed in clothes, the official added.

319.title: US-based Biliti Electric unveils hydrogen fuel cell-powered 3-wheeler
319.article_body: E-mobility company Biliti Electric has unveiled what it claims to be the world's first hydrogen fuel cell-powered electric three-wheeler vehicle. Biliti claimed the vehicle, named FastMile, has a refueling time of less than three minutes and offers a range of up to 209 kilometres. FastMile has a payload capacity of 680 kilograms and has been tested for over 9,656 kilometres.

320.title: UP minister Dinesh Khatik meets CM after resigning, says 'will continue in office'
320.article_body: A day after resigning as the Uttar Pradesh Minister of State for Jal Shakti, Dinesh Khatik on Thursday met CM Yogi Adityanath and said he'll continue in the post. "Whatever my issues were, I've put them before the CM. Action will be taken," he said. Khatik had alleged that he was being ignored by officials as he is a Dalit.

321.title: Ukrainian First Lady appeals for more weapons to US lawmakers
321.article_body: Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska has addressed US lawmakers, appealing for more western weapons, particularly air defence systems, in its war against Russia. The request came as Russia indicated plans to take broader areas in eastern Ukraine. Till date, the US and NATO have sent HIMARS rocket launchers, heavy artillery, armor, drones, air defence systems and warplanes to Ukraine.

322.title: 4 killed as under-construction building's wall falls in Bengaluru
322.article_body: Four persons were killed and four others sustained injuries when the wall of an under-construction building fell on them in Bengaluru on early Thursday morning. The deceased were identified as construction labourers from Bihar, who were sleeping at their worksite on Soukya Road in Hosakote area at the time of the accident. The injured were rushed to a nearby hospital.

323.title: Minister plays drums after Droupadi Murmu becomes President of India
323.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi played drums after NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu became the President of India on Thursday. Murmu has become India's first tribal woman President. She won against Opposition nominee Yashwant Sinha by a huge margin. PM Narendra Modi congratulated Murmu and said, "Her record victory augurs well for our democracy."

324.title: US Prez Biden unveils measures to tackle climate change
324.article_body: US President Joe Biden has unveiled a set of executive measures to tackle climate change, calling it "literally an existential threat to our nation". The move comes as parts of the US experience extremely high temperatures. According to the measures, states will be provided $2.3 billion to "increase resilience to heat waves, drought, wildfires, flood, hurricanes, and other hazards".

325.title: Govt to introduce new Emigration Bill for safe & legal migrations
325.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs will introduce a new Emigration Bill to promote "safe and legal" migration and prevent illegal recruitment agencies from cheating people, the Centre told Rajya Sabha on Thursday. "[The] new...bill...will take into account a lot of digital tracking," EAM S Jaishankar said. Centre is also working with state governments to spread awareness on safe emigration.

326.title: PM Modi visits Droupadi Murmu's residence to congratulate her on becoming President
326.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Droupadi Murmu's residence to congratulate her on being elected as the 15th President of India. A video has been shared online showing PM Modi greeting her with a bouquet. BJP National President JP Nadda was also present. Droupadi Murmu is the second woman to be elected as India's President.

327.title: KL Rahul tests positive for COVID-19 ahead of India-West Indies series
327.article_body: India batter KL Rahul has tested positive for COVID-19, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said. Rahul was included in India's squad for the T20I series against West Indies subject to fitness. Rahul last played an international match in February this year. He hasn't played professional cricket since IPL 2022 due to a groin injury. He had undergone groin operation in June.

328.title: India scripts history: PM as he congratulates Droupadi Murmu on being elected President
328.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while congratulating Droupadi Murmu on being elected President of India, tweeted, "India scripts history." "A daughter of India hailing from a tribal community born in a remote part of eastern India has been elected our President!" he added. "Her record victory augurs well for our democracy," the PM wrote.

329.title: 15,000 Russians troops killed fighting in Ukraine, says CIA chief
329.article_body: CIA chief William Burns on Wednesday said the US estimates that around 15,000 Russian troops have been killed and 45,000 others have been injured in the war in Ukraine. "The Ukrainians have suffered as well - probably a little less than that. But, you know, significant casualties," he added. Currently, Russian forces occupy around a fifth of the country.

330.title: Facebook's main feed to be revamped to prioritise content discovery: Meta
330.article_body: Meta on Thursday said it was revamping Facebook's main feed to prioritise "discovery" of new content, instead of posts and accounts users follow. 'Home', Facebook's main news feed tab, will start heavily featuring popular posts from accounts that users don't follow, including reels and stories. Facebook is investing in artificial intelligence to serve recommended content, Meta said.

331.title: We will continue to stand by the people of Sri Lanka: MEA
331.article_body: Amid the severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka, a spokesperson for the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said, "We will continue to stand by the people of Sri Lanka." The comment came a day after the Sri Lankan Parliament elected Ranil Wickremesinghe as the country's President. India has provided aid, including medicines and fuel supplies, to Sri Lanka.

332.title: Man hides $13,000 inside his turban, caught at Kolkata airport
332.article_body: Customs officials at Kolkata airport on Tuesday arrested three people and recovered $42,000 from them. One of them was carrying $13,000 by hiding currency notes in the folds of his turban. Around $29,000 were kept on the outer side of two different bags by removing the stitching and sewing it back with the money inside.

333.title: Yashwant Sinha pens note after losing Presidential election, quotes Bhagavad Gita
333.article_body: Yashwant Sinha tweeted a note after losing Presidential election to Droupadi Murmu. "I accepted...offer of Opposition parties solely guided by...philosophy of Karma Yoga preached by Lord Krishna in...Bhagavad Gita- 'Do your duty without expectation of fruits thereof'," he wrote. He congratulated Murmu, saying, "India hopes...she functions as...Custodian of the Constitution without fear or favour."

334.title: US President Joe Biden tests positive for COVID-19
334.article_body: US President Joe Biden has tested positive for COVID-19, the White House said on Thursday. The White House added that he is "fully vaccinated and twice boosted and experiencing very mild symptoms". He will isolate at the White House and "will continue to carry out all of his duties fully during that time," the press release stated.

335.title: Govt spent ₹911 crore on advertisements over last 3 yrs: Thakur
335.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday informed the Rajya Sabha that the Centre had spent ₹911.17 crore on advertisements in newspapers, television channels and web portals in the past three years. Advertisements on newspapers accounted for over ₹690 crore of the total amount, according to Thakur. TV advertisements cost the government nearly 200 crore, Thakur said.

336.title: 'Death pool' that kills anything that swims into it discovered at the bottom of Red Sea
336.article_body: Scientists from University of Miami have discovered a long brine pool at the bottom of Red Sea that's lethal to most creatures. Rare brine pools in Red Sea are extremely salty. They cannot sustain marine life forms because they are devoid of oxygen. The scientists made the discovery at a depth of 1,770 metre using a remotely operated underwater vehicle.

337.title: Air India Dubai-Cochin flight diverted to Mumbai after 'low pressure' in cabin
337.article_body: A Dubai-Cochin Air India flight was diverted to Mumbai after an incident of low pressure was reported in the cabin, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said. The flight landed safely in Mumbai, the DGCA added. "Two senior officers of O/o DAS WR have been assigned the task to carry out a preliminary investigation," the DGCA further stated.

338.title: Droupadi Murmu set to become President of India as she crosses halfway mark
338.article_body: Droupadi Murmu is set to become the 15th President of India after crossing the 50% mark of total valid votes at the end of third round of counting. Hailing from Odisha's Mayurbhanj, she has served as the Governor of Jharkhand from 2015 to 2021. She's contesting against Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha. Voting for the post took place on July 18.

339.title: Russia's war on Ukraine making China rethink on Taiwan: CIA chief
339.article_body: China is basing Russian military offensive in Ukraine to determine when and how, and not whether, to invade Taiwan, CIA chief Bill Burns has said. Burns added that China is "unsettled" when looking at Russia-Ukraine war, calling it "strategic failure" for Russian President Vladimir Putin. Notably, China has warned US of consequences if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan.

340.title: Kejriwal ignores LG's advice, says 'will go ahead' with Singapore visit
340.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wrote a letter to Delhi LG VK Saxena, saying he'll "go ahead" and attend World Cities Summit in Singapore. Earlier, Saxena advised Kejriwal to not attend the summit, saying prima facie it's meant for Mayors. "Then the Prime Minister wouldn't be able to go anywhere...[In] most of his visits, he...discusses subjects [outside his jurisdiction]," Kejriwal said.

341.title: Last rites of Haryana DSP killed amid mining raid performed in Hisar
341.article_body: The last rites of Haryana DSP Surender Singh, who was run over by a truck during a mining raid in Nuh, were performed with full state honours at his native village in Hisar on Thursday. Deputy Speaker Ranbir Gangwa, Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi and DGP PK Agrawal were present there. He is survived by his wife and two children.

342.title: Parts of ₹14,850-crore Bundelkhand Expressway cave in within 5 days of inauguration
342.article_body: Pictures have surfaced online showing parts of Bundelkhand Expressway caving in. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had inaugurated the expressway in Uttar Pradesh on July 16. The expressway has been constructed at a cost of ₹14,850 crore. The expressway passes through seven districts of Uttar Pradesh, namely Chitrakoot, Banda, Mahoba, Hamirpur, Jalaun, Auraiya and Etawah.

343.title: Govt’s aim is 'character assassination': Pilot on Sonia's ED questioning
343.article_body: Criticising the Centre over Congress chief Sonia Gandhi's questioning by the ED, party leader Sachin Pilot on Thursday said that the BJP government's sole aim is to indulge in the "character assassination" of people. "This questioning has been initiated to damage the morale of the leadership, target the Opposition and trample upon the voice of the Opposition," he said.

344.title: No COVID-19 restrictions during Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi, Muharram: Maha CM
344.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said all COVID-related restrictions during Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi and Muharram have been lifted in the state. There are no restrictions on the height of Ganesh's idols, Shinde said. "Our festival should be celebrated without any problems...A single window permission system will be there. All the concession will be given," he added.

345.title: European Central Bank raises interest rates for first time in 11 years
345.article_body: The European Central Bank (ECB) on Thursday raised interest rates for the first time in more than 11 years. The ECB raised its key interest rate by 0.5 percentage points to 0.0%. The ECB said that the increase is necessary to limit the pressure on prices over the next two years. It also increased its main refinancing rate to 0.50%.

346.title: Man stabs, pushes brother off 4th floor over property dispute in B'luru
346.article_body: A 37-year-old man allegedly killed his younger brother by stabbing him and pushing him from the fourth floor of a building over a property dispute in Bengaluru. According to reports, an argument broke out between the two brothers when the accused proposed the sale of one of two buildings owned by their father to clear loans.

347.title: Demanding patch-up with wife, drunk man climbs mobile tower in Maha
347.article_body: A man, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, climbed atop a 100-foot mobile phone tower in Maharashtra, seeking his wife's return from her parent's place, a police official said on Thursday. The man came down only after an assurance from villagers, fire brigade and police personnel that they would strive to solve the domestic dispute, he added.

348.title: Summit is for Mayors: Delhi LG as he denies CM's plea for Singapore visit
