348.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena has refused to approve CM Arvind Kejriwal's proposal regarding visiting Singapore to attend the World Cities Summit. The LG advised Kejriwal to not attend the summit since it is a conference of Mayors and won't be befitting for a CM to attend it, ANI reported. The summit is set to commence on July 31.

349.title: Solar panels costing ₹88 cr to be installed on ORR cycling track in Hyd
349.article_body: Solar panels along the 21-km cycling track on outer ring road (ORR) will be installed by Hyderabad Growth Corridor Limited (HGCL), a wing of Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA), at a cost of ₹88.12 crore. "The solar panels...would generate about 7 MV to 9 MV power per year," an official said. The HGCL has reportedly invited tenders for the project.

350.title: Bengaluru records highest daily rainfall in July in 14 years
350.article_body: After recording the wettest June in 10 years, Bengaluru has seen the highest daily rainfall in July in 14 years after recording 82.6 mm of rainfall on July 20, IMD data said. According to the Karnataka State Natural Disaster Monitoring Centre, Sampangi Rama Nagar received the highest rainfall of 79.5 mm in 24 hours till 8:30 am on Thursday.

351.title: 2 dozen cars damaged during attack in housing society in Gurugram
351.article_body: Around 15 men damaged over two dozen cars at a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 70A, the police said on Wednesday. The assailants also assaulted the housing society's security guards, the police added. Sources have said that the attack is a result of a personal enmity with a resident of the society.

352.title: Pune RTO commences drive against illegal bike taxi services
352.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office on Monday commenced drive against illegally operating app-based auto rickshaw services and bike taxis. "We are strictly checking the auto-rickshaws and two-wheelers which are running without authorised meters and with the mobile app-based system," RTO official Ajit Shinde said. "Earlier, we had seized more than 250 illegal bikes. The same will be done now," he added.

353.title: If Sonia doesn't call off protests, we won't consider her Indian: Uma
353.article_body: Reacting to protests over Enforcement Directorate's summons to Congress' Sonia Gandhi in National Herald case, BJP's Uma Bharti said it'll be determined if Gandhi's an Indian citizen if she stops the protests. "Otherwise we won't...forget that she's of Italian origin and doesn't respect Indian law," Bharti tweeted. Seventy-five Congress MPs were detained today for protesting over Gandhi's summons.

354.title: HC refuses to entertain PIL seeking clean milk for Delhi citizens
354.article_body: The Delhi HC on Thursday refused to entertain a PIL to "advise" the Lieutenant Governor of Delhi and the Commissioner of city police to ensure a supply of clean and hygienic milk. In the petition, the petitioner said that the "neglected, abandoned and pathetic condition of the cattle" is affecting the health of Delhi citizens.

355.title: Trinamool Congress to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential election
355.article_body: The Trinamool Congress headed by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee will abstain from voting in the upcoming Vice Presidential poll, party MP Abhishek Banerjee said on Thursday. He said the party will not support NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar, who was the Governor of West Bengal. The Opposition has fielded Margaret Alva in the election.

356.title: No additional amount to be charged for issuing boarding passes at airport counters
356.article_body: Ministry of Civil Aviation on Thursday said it has come to its notice that airlines are charging additional amount for issuing boarding passes from the passengers seeking check-in at airport counters. "Airlines are advised not to charge any additional amount...as the same cannot be considered within the 'tariff' as provided under Rule 135 of the Aircraft Rules, 1937," it said.

357.title: Female users in India leaving Facebook over privacy fear: Meta study
357.article_body: Female Facebook users in India are leaving the platform over concerns about their safety and privacy, said a study conducted by Facebook-parent Meta which was reviewed by Reuters. "Concerns about content safety and unwanted contact impede women's Facebook use," the study added. Other obstacles faced by Facebook include nudity content, perceived complexity of its app design and literacy barriers.

358.title: Break BJP's prison, bring people's government in 2024: WB CM Mamata
358.article_body: While addressing a rally in Kolkata, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday urged the people to break BJP's prison and elect a people's government in the 2024 elections. "What will the people eat when the BJP is implementing GST on everything, even puffed rice and milk powder. How will the poor survive in this country?" she said.

359.title: OYO marketing chief Rohit Kapoor likely to join Swiggy: Report
359.article_body: Hotel aggregation platform OYO's Global Chief Marketing Officer, Rohit Kapoor, has reportedly quit and will join Swiggy as its first Chief Executive Officer of food delivery business, according to reports. Rohit Kapoor took on his current role in April 2022, after Ankit Gupta was elevated as CEO of Softbank-backed OYO. He will report to Swiggy founder and CEO Sriharsha Majety.

360.title: 94 YouTube channels, 19 social media accounts blocked in 2021-22: Govt
360.article_body: Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday said that in 2021-22, the government blocked 94 YouTube channels, 19 social media accounts and 747 URLs engaged in anti-India activities. Government has taken strict measures to stop people from creating propaganda, Thakur said. "The government also issues advisory...to the media to adhere to the laid down Codes," he added.

361.title: Nykaa, Estee Lauder launch beauty incubator with ₹4-crore pool
361.article_body: Beauty and personal care retailer Nykaa has launched an incubator programme, Beauty&You India, in partnership with American beauty brand Estee Lauder with a prize pool of ₹4 crore. The new incubator programme allows beauty companies to showcase their brand and have an opportunity for acquisition. Apart from the prize money, the winners will also get mentorship from industry experts.

362.title: 7 get jail term for harassing women during Bonalu festival in Hyd
362.article_body: A local court on Wednesday sentenced seven persons to undergo jail term for harassing women during Bonalu festivities, Hyderabad Police tweeted. The accused were taking photographs of women visiting the temple on the occasion of the festival and were caught red-handed by the She Teams, police stated. The accused were sentenced to prison ranging from two days to ten days.

363.title: ODI cricket is dying, I think it should be scrapped: Wasim Akram
363.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has said that ODI cricket is dying, adding that administrators should consider scrapping the 50-over format. Akram added, "It's quite tiring for a player to play one-day cricket. After T20, one-day cricket seems it is going for days. So players are focussing on more shorter format. And longer format obviously [with] Test cricket."

364.title: 2 killed as their vehicle rams into container truck in UP's Basti
364.article_body:
Two people were killed when the vehicle they were travelling in rammed into a container truck after it was hit by another truck from behind in Uttar Pradesh's Basti, police said on Thursday.
The deceased have been identified as 45-year-old Manjay Yadav and 35-year-old Raju. The accident affected the movement of traffic on the highway for sometime, police added.

365.title: Droupadi Murmu leads by 812 votes after 2nd round of counting in Presidential poll
365.article_body: BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu is leading by a margin of 812 votes after the second round of counting in the Presidential poll. Murmu has received 1,349 votes so far, valued at 4,83,299, Rajya Sabha Secretary General PC Mody said. Meanwhile, Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha has got 537 votes, valued at 1,89,876, he added.

366.title: 300 units of free electricity in Gujarat if AAP wins: Kejriwal
366.article_body: In the run up to Gujarat Assembly elections, Aam Aadmi Party national convener Arvind Kejriwal has promised free electricity up to 300 units per month if elected. Speaking at a town hall meeting in Surat, Kejriwal said AAP will waive off pending power bills till December 31, 2021. This will be implemented within three months of being elected, he said.

367.title: Samajwadi Party intimidates Muslims for votes: SBSP chief
367.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Thursday criticised his alliance partner Samajwadi Party over its treatment of Muslims. "The Samajwadi Party (SP) gets votes of Muslims by intimidating them but when the time comes to give the Muslim community their rights, the party turns its back on them," Om Prakash Rajbhar said.

368.title: UK Queen's jewels on show at Buckingham Palace to mark 70-yr reign
368.article_body: Personal jewels of UK's Queen Elizabeth II will be put on display at Buckingham Palace from Friday for Platinum Jubilee celebrations. Tiaras, earrings and necklaces form part of "The Queen’s Accession" exhibition, which marks her seven decades on the throne. Queen Elizabeth II is the second-longest reigning monarch in the world after France's Louis XIV who reigned for 72 years.

369.title: Mahindra shares edited pic of footwear outside UK PM's residence as Sunak enters top 2
369.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share an edited viral picture of footwear outside UK PM's residence, 10 Downing Street. "Brit-Indian humour has gone into overdrive with Shri [Rishi] Sunak in the final shortlist of two [in UK PM race]. Of course the real test lies ahead with the larger mass of party faithful," he wrote.

370.title: Woman gives birth on road in UP after accident, dies minutes later
370.article_body: A woman gave birth to her child on a road minutes before her death because of a road accident in UP, police said on Thursday. The deceased, along with her husband, was travelling on their motorcycle when a truck rammed into the two-wheeler near Bartara village, ASP (city) Mukesh Chandra Mishra said.

371.title: Good job: Moosewala's father after gangsters killed in police encounter
371.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala's father, Balkaur Singh, visited Amritsar hospital to identify the two gangsters who were killed in an encounter with Punjab Police on Wednesday. Gangsters Jagroop Singh Roopa and Manpreet Singh were involved in Moosewala's murder. "It's a good job done by Punjab Police and such actions should continue...This is just a start," Balkaur said after identifying their bodies.

372.title: Bengaluru civic body to file FIRs against illegal banners
372.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike will lodge an FIR by the end of this week against persons installing illegal banners. Speaking on hundreds of political banners installed recently, BBMP chief Tushar Giri Nath said, "We have warned...several times...FIR will be lodged against the violators." As per a High Court order, no banners can be put up in BBMP limits.

373.title: Everything’s fine with Putin: Kremlin rejects rumours on his health
373.article_body: The Kremlin on Thursday said that "everything is fine" with Russian President Vladimir Putin's health. "Ukrainian information specialists and American and British ones have been throwing out various fakes [rumours] about the state of the President's health," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. A video showing Putin limping as he arrived in Iran on Tuesday has surfaced on social media.

374.title: Control room set up to facilitate Kanwar Yatra in GB Nagar: Police
374.article_body: A special control room has been set up to facilitate movement of Kanwariyas through the Gautam Buddha Nagar district, police officials said on Wednesday. The control centre has been set up at the Chilla border in Noida, they added. Separately, movement of heavy vehicles has also been restricted on the routes used by Kanwariyas, a senior police official said.

375.title: Congress workers burn car near B'luru ED office during protest
375.article_body: Congress workers protesting against Enforcement Directorate (ED) summons to party chief Sonia Gandhi on Thursday burnt a car near the agency's Bengaluru office. Congress workers are protesting across the country against ED questioning Sonia in the National Herald case. She left the ED office in Delhi after being questioned for nearly two hours on Thursday.

376.title: 2 men arrested for stealing bikes & selling them online in Kalyan
376.article_body: Thane Police has arrested two men for motor vehicle theft. The accused, Mohammed Shaikh and Abubakar Shaikh, used to search for bikes on OLX, ask the seller for documents and details and then steal a similar bike. They then created fake documents based on documents taken from the seller, change the stolen bike's number plate and sell it online.

377.title: Woman who accused Rajasthan minister's son of rape moves Delhi HC
377.article_body: A woman who accused Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi's son of raping her multiple times moved Delhi HC on Thursday seeking cancellation of anticipatory bail granted to the man by trial court. The woman in her petition stated that the accused, Rohit, has been threatening her to withdraw her complaint since being out on bail. She filed the complaint in May.

378.title: 2 Kanwar Yatris killed, 3 injured in accident on Delhi-Haridwar highway
378.article_body: Two Kanwar Yatris died and three were injured in a head-on collision between two scooters on the Delhi-Haridwar highway in Uttarakhand on Wednesday night, police said. Due to the impact of the collision, the victims were flung into the air and landed several feet away, an official said. The deceased have been identified as Rahul and Shyam Thakur.

379.title: World 100m champion Kerley out of world 4x100m relay with injury
379.article_body: Newly-crowned 100m champion Fred Kerley has been ruled out of the US team for the 4x100m relay at the World Championships in Oregon with a "slight injury to his quadriceps". Kerley suffered the injury in the 200m semi-finals, finishing sixth in 20.68 seconds. Kerley had said he cramped up in the later stages of the 200m.

380.title: Bihar electrician dies while fixing transformer as someone switches on power
380.article_body: An electrician, who had climbed a transformer to repair a technical glitch, was reportedly burnt alive at a village in Bihar's Nalanda district after someone switched on the power supply. "The technician went on the transformer after he cross-checked with the power supply station," a villager said. "It looks like someone deliberately switched on the power supply," he added.

381.title: Naomi Osaka parts ways with coach Wim Fissette
381.article_body: Former world number one Naomi Osaka has parted ways with her coach Wim Fissette. Osaka won two of her four Grand Slam titles, the US Open in 2020 and the Australian Open in 2021, under Fissette's guidance. "It has been a privilege to coach Naomi since 2019 and see her grow into the champion she has become," said Fissette.

382.title: Azam is Pak's captain cool, should lead us until retirement: Miandad
382.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Javed Miandad said Babar Azam is Pakistan's "captain cool", adding that he should lead the national team until he retires from cricket. "[He is] our number one captain...He leads from the front," stated Miandad. "The most important thing is he is performing brilliantly himself," he said. Former India captain MS Dhoni is known as 'captain cool'.

383.title: Myanmar's economy remains fragile amid civil strife: World Bank
383.article_body: Myanmar's economy remains fragile amid civil strife in the country, the World Bank and other experts said on Thursday. "Inequality is estimated to have worsened, with those already poor falling into deeper destitution," the World Bank claimed. Myanmar is one of several countries in Asia whose economies are imperilled by soaring prices and weaker currencies, according to a report.

384.title: Aamir hosts Gujarati dinner for 'Avengers: Endgame' directors Russo brothers, pic viral
384.article_body: Aamir Khan hosted a Gujarati dinner for Anthony and Joe Russo, the directors of 'Avengers: Endgame', who are in India for the promotional tour of 'The Gray Man'. They were also joined by the film's actor Dhanush and Aamir's ex-wife Kiran Rao. Aamir reportedly also flew down chefs specialising in Gujarati delicacies for the dinner.

385.title: I will never sing with him: Priyanka Chopra on husband Nick Jonas
385.article_body: Actress-singer Priyanka Chopra said she will "never sing" with husband and singer Nick Jonas. "I don't have the audacity to collaborate with him...Whenever I sing in the car, like when my jam is on...then he'll just look at me like that, I just get quiet," Priyanka had earlier stated. Priyanka and Nick got married in 2018.

386.title: Matter of pride for tribals if she becomes next Prez: Murmu's brother
386.article_body: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu's brother Tarinisen Tudu on Thursday said that it will be a matter of pride for the tribal community, Odisha and the country if she becomes the next President of India. The counting of votes began on Thursday, with Murmu bagging 540 votes after the first round. Opposition candidate Yashwant Sinha managed 208 votes.

387.title: Karti Chidambaram writes to Serious Fraud Investigation Office to review Byju's finances
387.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has written to Serious Fraud Investigation Office to investigate finances of Byju's. Chidambaram stated Byju's violated law by missing the legal deadline to file the Cost Audit Report for FY 2020-21. "Byju's proposes to...acquire Nasdaq-listed company 2U for $2.4 billion, while parallelly firing employees...it becomes pertinent to review [its] finances," he wrote.

388.title: Govt releases pic of 1st stamp of independent India
388.article_body: The government on Thursday released a picture of the first stamp of independent India. "The 1st Stamp of Independent India was issued on November 21, 1947 and was valued at three & a half annas," it tweeted with the picture. The picture was released under 'Moments With Tiranga' campaign.

389.title: Big question mark: Kartik on rumours about his cameo in Ranbir's film
389.article_body: Reacting to the rumours that he will be making a cameo in Luv Ranjan's upcoming film, actor Kartik Aaryan has said, "It's a big question mark." The film features actor Ranbir Kapoor and actress Shraddha Kapoor. Speaking about Luv, Kartik said, "He has been my lucky charm. Our journey has been great. I can't say much about the film."

390.title: Autonomous vehicle with detachable steering wheel unveiled by China's Baidu
390.article_body: China's search engine giant Baidu on Thursday unveiled its new autonomous vehicle (AV) with a detachable steering wheel, with plans to put it to use for its robotaxi service in China next year. The new AV won't need human intervention and will have eight lidars and 12 cameras alongside it. The AV's price will also drop to about 2,50,000 yuan.

391.title: Shiv Sena leader backing Uddhav Thackeray attacked in Maha, 2 held
391.article_body: Police on Thursday arrested two people in connection with the attack on a worker of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena in Maharashtra, an official said. Harshawardhan Palande, Deputy Chief of the Sena's Kalyan city unit, was attacked by four to five men with sticks and rods on Wednesday, a police official said.

392.title: BJP is blinded by their desire for revenge: Baghel on Sonia's ED questioning
392.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED on Thursday, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said the BJP is "blinded by their desire for revenge". "This is the same woman who was married to [former] PM Rajiv Gandhi," Baghel added. "Sonia Gandhi has not been well, of late, and yet the BJP is after her," he stated.

393.title: School bus with 21 kids catches fire in Delhi, no casualties; video surfaces
393.article_body: A bus carrying 21 children from the Bal Bharti Public School caught fire in the middle of a road in Delhi's Rohini on Thursday. No one was injured in the incident due to quick action by the driver, police said. A video shows flames engulfing the bus, rising several feet above it. Three cars near the bus were also burnt.

394.title: Former beauty queen arrested for stealing wine worth $1.5 million in Spain
394.article_body: A 28-year-old former beauty queen from Mexico has been arrested for stealing wine from a Spanish restaurant. Priscila Lara Guevara, along with a Romanian-Dutch man, stole 45 vintage bottles worth $1.5 million, The Telegraph said in its report quoting the Spanish media. Guevara and the man were caught this week crossing into Croatia from Montenegro.

395.title: Told Disha 'You need to take yourself more seriously' after Malang: Mohit
395.article_body: Talking about Disha Patani, filmmaker Mohit Suri said, "When I watched the climax of 'Malang' with the audience, I...messaged her...'You need to take yourself more seriously. You're not just a pretty face'." He added very few people take it as a compliment and she understood what he was trying to say. "She should...take herself...seriously as an actor," he concluded.

396.title: Doors of Matoshree open for those who want to return: Aaditya to Shinde camp
396.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA Aaditya Thackeray on Thursday said that real Shiv Sainiks are still with the party led by Uddhav Thackeray. Referring to MLAs who joined Eknath Shinde-led government, he added that the doors of Matoshree are going to remain open for those who want to return. The ones we trusted and offered ministerial posts, backstabbed us, he further said.

397.title: Wrong to summon 2 members of same family again & again: Cong leader
397.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED in connection with the National Herald case on Thursday, party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said it is wrong to summon two members of the same family over and over again, that too in connection with the same case. The agency earlier questioned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the case.

398.title: It's duragrah not satyagrah: BJP MP Prasad on Congress' protests
398.article_body: Commenting on the protests held by Congress over Sonia Gandhi's appearance before the Enforcement Directorate (ED), BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "This is not satyagrah but duragrah against the country, its laws and its agencies." "This is also a duragrah for protecting the family which has pocketed the party's assets worth thousands of crores of rupees," the MP added.

399.title: 26-yr-old man stealing bikes on pretext of trial rides held in Mumbai
399.article_body: A 26-year-old man from Hyderabad, Zubair Irfan Sayyed, was arrested in Mumbai for stealing multiple luxury bikes from people across the city on the pretext of trial rides. "In May, Sayyed absconded with a Charkop resident's Trump bike," a police official said. Two expensive bikes, which are worth about ₹15 lakh, were also recovered from the accused, police added.

400.title: 42-year-old man arrested for cheating woman of ₹2.30 lakh in Thane
400.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Sagar Raut, was arrested from Thane for allegedly cheating a woman of ₹2.30 lakh after befriending her on Facebook, police said on Wednesday. Gaining the woman's confidence, Raut asked her to invest money in a financial scheme. After taking ₹2.30 lakh, he allegedly assured her that he will pay her ₹20,000 per month as return on investment.
